Issues.Title: fix(ngcc): ensure private exports are added for `ModuleWithProviders`
Issues.Body:
ngcc may need to insert public exports into the bundle's source as well
as to the entry-point's declaration file, as the Ivy compiler may need
to create import statements to internal library types. The way ngcc
knows which exports to add is through the references registry, to which
references to things that require a public export are added by the
various analysis steps that are executed.

One of these analysis steps is the augmentation of declaration files
where functions that return `ModuleWithProviders` are updated so that a
generic type argument is added that corresponds with the `NgModule` that
is actually imported. This type has to be publicly exported, so the
analyzer step has to add the module type to the references registry.

A problem occurs when `ModuleWithProviders` already has a generic type
argument, in which case no update of the declaration file is necessary.
This may happen when 1) ngcc is processing additional bundle formats, so
that the declaration file has already been updated while processing the
first bundle format, or 2) when a package is processed which already
contains the generic type in its source. In both scenarios it may occur
that the referenced `NgModule` type does not yet have a public export,
so it is crucial that a reference to the type is added to the
references registry, which ngcc failed to do.

This commit fixes the issue by always adding the referenced `NgModule`
type to the references registry, so that a public export will always be
created if necessary.

Resolves FW-1575
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ngcc): ensure private exports are added for `ModuleWithProviders`" (#32902)

Issues.Title: fix(ngcc): handle presence of both `ctorParameters` and `__decorate`
Issues.Body:
Recently ng-packagr was updated to include a transform that used to be
done in tsickle (https://github.com/ng-packagr/ng-packagr/pull/1401),
where only constructor parameter decorators are emitted in tsickle's
format, not any of the other decorators.

ngcc used to only a single format, so once it sees the `ctorParameters`
it assumes the library uses the tsickle format, therefore it does not
consider any of the `__decorate` calls. This resulted in missing
decorator information, preventing proper processing of a package.

This commit adds support for recognizing the situation where only the
`ctorParameters` static property is present with additional decorator
information present in `__decorate` calls, and will merge the two
sources appropriately.

Resolves FW-1573
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ngcc): handle presence of both `ctorParameters` and `__decorate`" (#32901)

Issues.Title: Support finishCallback and rootZoneStable in async test
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ 

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for zone.js


### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability...
the cases is from `angular components`, the following test are from @mmalerba.

```
fdescribe('repro', () => {
  beforeEach(async () => {
    await TestBed.configureTestingModule({
      declarations: [OutsideNgZoneTest]
    }).compileComponents();
  });

  # Passes
  it('done should not wait for task outside of zone', done => {
    const fixture = TestBed.createComponent(OutsideNgZoneTest);
    const el = fixture.debugElement.nativeElement;
    fixture.detectChanges();
    fixture.whenStable().then(() => {
      expect(el.classList.contains('timeout-done')).toBe(false);
      done();
    });
  });

  # Passes
  it('fakeAsync should wait for task outside of zone', fakeAsync(() => {
    const fixture = TestBed.createComponent(OutsideNgZoneTest);
    const el = fixture.debugElement.nativeElement;
    fixture.detectChanges();
    flush();
    expect(el.classList.contains('timeout-done')).toBe(true);
  }));

  # Fails
  it('async should wait for task outside of zone', async(() => {
    const fixture = TestBed.createComponent(OutsideNgZoneTest);
    const el = fixture.debugElement.nativeElement;
    fixture.detectChanges();
    fixture.whenStable().then(() => {
      expect(el.classList.contains('timeout-done')).toBe(true);
    });
  }));
});

@Component({template: ''})
export class OutsideNgZoneTest {
  constructor(el: ElementRef, ngZone: NgZone) {
    ngZone.runOutsideAngular(() =>
        setTimeout(() => el.nativeElement.classList.add('timeout-done')));
  }
}
```

For the `1st and 3rd` cases, we want some mechanism to let user to easily test the async cases.
### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> If you have a solution in mind, please describe it.
- For the `1st case` we may need some thing like
`rootZoneWhenStable().then()` or `asyncStable().then()` to monitor not only `ngZone` but also the `async tasks` outside of `ngZone`.

- For the `3rd case`, we need to add an option to `async` zone spec, to let user monitor when all async are done. 

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Have you considered any alternative solutions or workarounds?
No very easy workarounds for now.

Issues.Title: NGCC silently ignores some components
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package `@angular/compiler-cli` and maybe `@angular/compiler`. ### Is this a regression? Not sure, probably not a regression. ### Description NGCC silently ignores some components, i.e. does not update the `.d.ts` files in the library, which results in completely misleading errors about missing components down the road, when Angular application attempts to use library compiled with NGCC. I've faced these errors, when attempting to upgrade [angular-fontawesome](https://github.com/devoto13/angular-fontawesome/tree/angular-9) (see last commit in the branch) to Angular 9. NGCC should either compile ALL components or fail or at the very least print a warning that it was unable to compile certain components from the library for certain reason. This way library authors can either avoid using undesired behaviours or report clear issues here. Two cases where `ngcc` silently skips components, which I've identified so far are: - injecting `Renderer2` into a component - injecting a directive into a component ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/devoto13/ngcc-skip-components-repro Repository is created using schematics (each command is one commit): ``` $ ng new eval-lib $ ng g lib test # import component from the library into application # inject `Renderer2` into library component (this leads to an error) ``` How to reproduce a bug: ``` # clone repo $ npm i $ ng build test --prod # build the library $ ng build --prod # attempt to build the application using this library ``` Observe a misleading error about missing component. Observe that `dist/test/lib/test.component.d.ts` was not processed by NGCC and no clear error or warning was printed. Reverting latest commit in the repo will allow the application build to pass and application will run successfully. ## üî• Exception or Error 
ERROR in src/app/app.component.html:1:1 - error TS8001: 'lib-test' is not a valid HTML element.

1 
  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

  src/app/app.component.ts:5:16
    5   templateUrl: './app.component.html',
                     ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    Error occurs in the template of component AppComponent.
## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:**

Node: 12.7.0
OS: darwin x64

Issues.Title: Discuss: Router `initialNavigation` values and defaults
Issues.Body:
Currently the allowed values for `initialNavigation` parameter for the router `ExtraOptions` are `enabled` and `disabled` (and deprecated `enabled_legacy` and `disabled_legacy`).

### Problem
`initialNavigation` parameter not only controls whether to perform initial navigation on router initialization(parse the URL and set the router state) but also whether to block the application bootstrap until the route is fully resolved (fetch lazy loaded chunks and finish rendering).

`enabled` actually means both perform initial navigation and also block application bootstrap.

The doc mentions `enabled` is the default. It is not the case. The default is `enabled_legacy` which does initial navigation but does *not* block the application bootstrap. 

`enabled` is not a good default for client side rendered applications because we want them to perform initial navigation without actually waiting for the route to be fully resolved. (Or otherwise the whole page will be blank and affect FCP and other performance metrics).

### Proposal
Have 3 states for `initialNavigation` :
- `enabledNonBlocking`: This should be the default when unspecified
- `enabledBlocking` : This is the new clearer name for `enabled`
- `disabled`: Same as before - No initial navigation or blocking

Optional:
- Deprecate `enabled` (or alternatively mention in the doc that `enabled` and `enabledBlocking` are equivalent)

Client side rendered apps should get the saner default of `enabledNonBlocking`. SSR apps will set `initialNavigation` to `enabledBlocking` to avoid flicker when directly navigating to a lazy loaded route.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Discuss: Router `initialNavigation` values and defaults" (#32887)

Issues.Title: fix(compiler-cli): don't set `emitDecoratorMetadata` to `true` when not using tsickle
Issues.Body:
fix(compiler-cli): don't set `emitDecoratorMetadata` to `true` when not using tsickle

Currently, in the `createEmitCallback` we are always setting `emitDecoratorMetadata` to true, even if this is only needed for when using tsickle not to elide imports.

In ng-packagr, we have a copy of `createEmitCallback` (https://github.com/ng-packagr/ng-packagr/blob/master/src/lib/ngc/create-emit-callback.ts) and we discovered that we will always emit `__metadata` helpers even when we don't want. Such such case if when using the ctor transformer which is a workaround for the `forwardRef` temporary dead zone (TDZ)

Also, this PR remove the redundant else part of the emit.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(compiler-cli): don't set `emitDecoratorMetadata` to `true` when not using tsickle" (#32880)

Issues.Title: WHy angular is retarded?
Issues.Body:
Spoiler: no template i have no time to waste

Problem: Reactive forms
div with [ngClass] directive:

``div
                    class="custom-control custom-checkbox"
                    style="padding-left:80px; padding-top:30px;"
                    [ngClass]="{
                      'd-none': f.somereactiveformcontrol.value !== '1'
                    }"
                  >``
f is a getter in .ts file that returns all controls (and work everywhere else)
d-none is bootstrap display:none class
f.somereactiveformcontrol.value is a select/option dropdown which if !==1 shows div else hides it as you can guess

When dropdown activated manually it works
when the dropdown changes because changed from code (using your (change) method binding)
it doesn't change

I'm fed up the whole framework is filled with this crap. Why you even do double way binding if works half the needed cases? Don't even make a framework at this point

I've read about observable something, but why would I use the whole framework if I had to use another framework and do my own implementation? It has no fucking sense.

If the customer didn't specifically asked for angular I would have thrown this piece of trash in the toilet long time ago

How to solve

EDIT: Thumbs down my ass, it's reality  that smacks your face üëç 
Instead of thumbing down like twitter and facebook kids, show me I'm wrong ü•á

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-optimizer): fix error when `__decorate` has‚Ä¶
Issues.Body:
‚Ä¶ no `__metadata`

When a `__decorator` expression has no `__metadata` call, example:

```js
__decorate([
    ContentChild('heading', { read: ElementRef, static: true })
], FooBarComponent.prototype, "buttons", void 0);
```

A `Cannot read property 'kind' of undefined` error will be thrown.

Closes: #15703

Issues.Title: build: update terser to version 4.3.4
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [terser](https://terser.org) ([source](https://togithub.com/terser/terser)) | dependencies | patch | [`4.3.2` -> `4.3.4`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/terser/4.3.2/4.3.4) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>terser/terser</summary>

### [`v4.3.4`](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v434)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/compare/v4.3.3...v4.3.4)

-   Fixed a regression where the output size was increased when unused classes were referred to in the extends clause of a class.
-   Small typescript typings fixes.
-   Comments with `@preserve`, `@license`, `@cc_on` as well as comments starting with `/*!` and `/**!` are now preserved by default.

### [`v4.3.3`](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v433)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/compare/v4.3.2...v4.3.3)

-   Fixed a problem where parsing template strings would mix up octal notation and a slash followed by a zero representing a null character.
-   Started accepting the name `async` in destructuring arguments with default value.
-   Now Terser takes into account side effects inside class `extends` clauses.
-   Added parens whenever there's a comment between a return statement and the returned value, to prevent issues with ASI.
-   Stopped using raw RegExp objects, since the spec is going to continue to evolve. This ensures Terser is able to process new, unknown RegExp flags and features. This is a breaking change in the AST node AST_RegExp.

</details>

---

Issues.Title: CSS variables incorrectly optimized using prod flag
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Description When defining border-radius property for each side manually (using `border-top-left-radius / border-bottom-left-radius / ...`), `ng build --prod` will merge those definitions together into a single `border-radius: ...` definition. However when using variables while still providing fallback values for older browsers who don't support variables, the variables will be ignored when using `ng build --prod`. This only happens when using the flag `--prod`. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction For reproduction purposes I created a simple Angular App. ```bash git clone https://github.com/David-Development/angular-css-minify-bug-app cd angular-css-minify-bug-app npm install ng serve ``` You'll notice that both divs look the same (both have rounded edges on the left side). So far, everything is correct. However, after running `ng build --prod`, you'll notice, that the second div has no round edges on the left side anymore. Somehow (I guess by doing some minifying) angular will merge the four attributes (`border-top-left-radius / border-bottom-left-radius / border-top-right-radius / border-bottom-right-radius`) together. The problem is, that by merging those attributes together, it is not considering variables. ## üî• Exception or Error The following css code: 

--control-border-radius: 10px;

border-top-left-radius: 1px;
border-bottom-left-radius: 1px;
    
border-top-left-radius: var(--control-border-radius);
border-bottom-left-radius: var(--control-border-radius);
border-top-right-radius: 0px;
border-bottom-right-radius: 0px;
is being converted to: (using `ng build --prod`) 

--control-border-radius: 10px;
...
border-top-left-radius: 1px;
border-bottom-left-radius: 1px;
    
border-top-left-radius: var(--control-border-radius);
border-bottom-left-radius: var(--control-border-radius);
border-top-right-radius: 0px;
border-bottom-right-radius: 0px;
border: 1px 0px 0px 1px;
## üåç Your Environment Tested in Angular 7 and 9 ## Related issue: - https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/10579 Unfortunately the described workaround does not work for me. ``` /* clean-css ignore:start */ ... /* clean-css ignore:end */ ```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "CSS variables incorrectly optimized using prod flag" (#15684)

Issues.Title: ng command not found on Mac
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report

<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are effected by this bug? -->
No, this is issue with installation on Macbook Pro
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Is this a regression?

<!-- Did this behavior use to work in the previous version? -->
I dont know, I am new to angular


### Description
STEPS
1. sudo npm uninstall -g angular-cli
2. sudo npm uninstall -g @angular/cli
3. sudo npm cache clean --force
4. sudo npm install -g @angular/cli
5. sudo npm link @angular/cli
6. ng -v results in -bash: ng: command not found
7. Under my /Users/dinob/ there is no directory .npm-global

PROBLEM: ng command is not found

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
STEPS
1. sudo npm uninstall -g angular-cli
2. sudo npm uninstall -g @angular/cli
3. sudo npm cache clean --force
4. sudo npm install -g @angular/cli
5. sudo npm link @angular/cli
6. ng -v results in -bash: ng: command not found
7. Under my /Users/dinob/ there is no directory .npm-global

## üî• Exception or Error
-bash: ng: command not found


## üåç Your Environment
ng version returns ng command not found
npm -v 6.9.0
node -v 10.16.0

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>bazelbuild/rules_nodejs</summary>

### [`v0.38.0`](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​0380httpsgithubcombazelbuildrulesnodejscompare03700380-2019-09-26)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/compare/0.37.1...0.38.0)

##### Bug Fixes

-   **builtin:** linker test should run program as an action ([#​1113](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/1113)) ([7f0102e](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/7f0102e))
-   add golden file ([9a02ee0](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/9a02ee0))
-   add missing async test fixes ([12f711a](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/12f711a))
-   **builtin:** support for scoped modules in linker ([#​1199](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/1199)) ([94abf68](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/94abf68))
-   **protractor:** update rules_webtesting patch to include additional windows fixes ([#​1140](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/1140)) ([f76e97b](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/f76e97b))
-   **rollup:** npm requires an index.js file ([2ababdf](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/2ababdf))

##### chore

-   cleanup some deprecated APIs ([#​1160](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/1160)) ([cefc2ae](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/cefc2ae)), closes [#​1144](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/1144)

##### Code Refactoring

-   remove http_server and history_server rules ([#​1158](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/1158)) ([01fdeec](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/01fdeec))

##### Features

-   **builtin:** detect APF node module format if ANGULAR_PACKAGE file found ([#​1112](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/1112)) ([162e436](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/162e436))
-   **builtin:** expose the new linker to node programs ([65d8a36](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/65d8a36))

-   **builtin:** linker should resolve workspace-absolute paths ([307a796](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/307a796))
-   **builtin:** npm_package_bin can produce directory output ([#​1164](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/1164)) ([6d8c625](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/6d8c625))
-   **examples:** demonstrate that a macro assembles a workflow ([7231aaa](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/7231aaa))
-   **examples:** replace examples/webapp with new rollup_bundle ([c6cd91c](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/c6cd91c))
-   **examples:** the Angular example now lives in rules_nodejs ([9072ddb](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/9072ddb))
-   **rollup:** ensure that sourcemaps work end-to-end ([f340589](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/f340589))
-   **rollup:** new implementation of rollup_bundle in [@​bazel/rollup](https://togithub.com/bazel/rollup) package ([3873715](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/3873715)), closes [#​532](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/532) [#​724](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/724)
-   **rollup:** support multiple entry points ([f660d39](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/f660d39))
-   **rollup:** tests and docs for new rollup_bundle ([cfef773](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/cfef773))
-   **terser:** support directory inputs ([21b5142](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/21b5142))
-   add angular example ([#​1124](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/1124)) ([c376355](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/c376355))
-   **terser:** support source map files ([#​1195](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/1195)) ([d5bac48](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/d5bac48))
-   **typescript:** add JSEcmaScriptModuleInfo provider to ts_library outputs ([1433eb9](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/1433eb9))

##### BREAKING CHANGES

-   [@​bazel/typescript](https://togithub.com/bazel/typescript) and [@​bazel/karma](https://togithub.com/bazel/karma) no longer have a defs.bzl file. Use
    index.bzl instead.

The [@​yarn](https://togithub.com/yarn) workspace is no longer created. Use @​nodejs//:yarn instead.

-   history_server and http_server rules are no longer built-in.

To use them, first install the http-server and/or history-server packages
Then load("@​npm//http-server:index.bzl", "http_server")
(or replace with history-server, noting that the rule has underscore where the package has hyphen)

-   **builtin:** linker test should run program as an action ([#​1113](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/1113)) ([7f0102e](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/7f0102e))

##### Features

-   **examples:** the Angular example now lives in rules_nodejs ([9072ddb](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/9072ddb))
-   add angular example ([#​1124](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/1124)) ([c376355](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/c376355))

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): add experimentalRollupPass
Issues.Body:
In applications that make heavy use of lazy routes and ES2015 libraries, this option can improve bundle sizes. It might also break your bundles in ways we don't understand fully, so please test and report any problems you find.

NOTE: the following are known problems with experimentalRollupPass
- vendorChunk, commonChunk, namedChunks: these won't work, because by the time webpack sees the chunks, the context of where they came from is lost.
- webWorkerTsConfig: workers must be imported via a root relative path (e.g.`app/search/search.worker`) instead of a relative path (`/search.worker`) because of the same reason as above.
- loadChildren string syntax: doesn't work because rollup cannot follow the imports.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): add experimentalRollupPass" (#15690)

Issues.Title: mat-progress-bar animation stops if route transition animation is present in Safari
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

StackBlitz to reproduce the issue: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-wf5g7b

Issue is reproducible in Safari browser. See details below.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create simple app with two routes and simple navigation between them.
2. Add route transition animation
3. Add mat-progress-bar with 'indeterminate' mode to one component.
4. When you navigate from one screen to the screen with progress bar, the progress bar does not animate.
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

Inteterminate progress bar should keep animating.


#### Actual Behavior

Inteterminate progress bar stops animating.


#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.8
- CDK/Material: 8.2.1
- Browser(s): Safari 13.0.1
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS Mojave 10.14.6
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-progress-bar animation stops if route transition animation is present in Safari" (#17233)

Issues.Title: Bug with mat-label & mat-autocomplete on iOS
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction
On iOS devices in safari mat-label (that should auto float) overlaps input text
Reproducible on https://material.angular.io/components/autocomplete/examples
https://stackblitz.com/angular/goyoyymgdgp?file=app%2Fautocomplete-simple-example.ts

screenshot with the issue
[https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BwabUX8IWhojajRxUWxiWDZ1Q1ZUUWlyVGhrWnI4dUtfbjFv/view?usp=sharing](url)

Steps to reproduce:
1. Focus on input field with autocomplete
2. Select any option proposed in autocomplete
3. Blur input
4. Focus on input again
5. Remove all text from input
6. Select other option from autocomplete
 
#### Expected Behavior
After another option gets selected, label floats up

#### Actual Behavior
After another option gets selected, label overlaps input text

#### Environment

- Angular: 8+
- CDK/Material: 8+
- Browser(s): iOS Safari
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): iOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Bug with mat-label & mat-autocomplete on iOS" (#17231)

Issues.Body:

Fixes #17121.

Issues.Title: fix(cdk-experimental/clipboard): avoid changing layout with temporary textarea
Issues.Body:
Currently the clipboard service creates a temporary invisible `textarea` from which to copy the text into the clipboard, however since it only has `opacity: 0`, it has the potential of changing the layout in a noticeable way if it is present for longer.

These changes add some extra styles to avoid changing the layout. I also did some small cleanup to make it a bit more robust.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(cdk-experimental/clipboard): avoid changing layout with temporary textarea" (#17227)

Issues.Body:

#### Expected Behavior
The placholder should be animating "behind" the rows

#### Actual Behavior
When draging an item "up" (index going down), then the placeholder is shown in *front* of the cards:

(note that I added border to the items, and black background, for better visualization)

#### Thoughts
- Playing with z-index has no effect
- Only happens when dragging to a lower index from the initial drag position
- Individual drag position is not relevant, just that it‚Äôs a transition at a lower index

#### Environment
- Angular: ?
- CDK/Material: 8.2.1
- Browser(s):
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Drag drop placeholder in front of elements" (#17208)

Issues.Title: fix(drag-drop): not picking up indirect descendant items
Issues.Body:
Fixes that the drop list doesn't pick up drop items that aren't direct descendants. This was put in on purpose before to try and enforce a simpler DOM structure, but it could be limiting in some cases (e.g. if users want to put an `ngSwitch` with an `ng-container` around it).

These changes also add some extra logic to ensure that items aren't picked up by more than one ancestor list.

Fixes #17047.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(drag-drop): not picking up indirect descendant items" (#17226)

Issues.Title: build: add workaround for bug breaking ts_library hermeticity
Issues.Body:
Patches `@bazel/typescript` to not be non-hermetic. We need to
work around this because it impacts the Bazel development workflow
significantly if file changes sometimes need a `bazel clean`
(basically breaking incrementality).

Issue is reported with in-depth details: https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/1208. I wanted to go for a fix, but apparently it involves a bigger discussion and is probably blocked by G3 syncs, so a workaround through postinstall seems reasonable for now.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: add workaround for bug breaking ts_library hermeticity" (#17225)

Issues.Title: prototype(progress-bar): create prototype progress bar based on MDC web
Issues.Body:
Implements the Angular Material progress bar on top of MDC web. The public API and behavior should be identical, aside from slight differences in the animation timings and easing curves.

**Note:** MDC's styles include an inline SVG which contains quotes and causes Bazel to create an invalid JS file when it tries to include the CSS in unit tests. These changes add a workaround where we exclude the progress bar theme from tests until the Bazel issue can be resolved.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "prototype(progress-bar): create prototype progress bar based on MDC web" (#17224)

Issues.Title: fix(overlay): block scroll strategy throwing off scroll behavior feature detection
Issues.Body:
To avoid a scrolling animation when we disable scrollig, we remove and re-set the `scroll-behavior` property on the body without feature checking it. The problem is that since we've set the property to *something*, our `scrollBehaviorSupported` feature check will be thrown off because it checks for `'scrollBehavior' in document.documentElement.style`.

Fixes #17221.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(overlay): block scroll strategy throwing off scroll behavior feature detection" (#17223)

Get access to the GoogleMap parent component from a MapMarker through

Issues.Title: BlockScrollStrategy affects supportsScrollBehavior method in IE11
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-cdk-overlay-issue-apycr4

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open [example](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-cdk-overlay-issue-apycr4) in IE11
2. Click "Open Dialog" button
3. Close Dialog
4. Click "Check supportsScrollBehavior" button
5. Open console
6. "ERROR!!! IE11 doesn't support scroll-behavior" message presented into the console
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

_BlockScrollStrategy.disable_ shouldn't add "scroll-behavior" style property to _html_ element by design.


#### Actual Behavior

_BlockScrollStrategy.disable_ was called by _MatDialog_ and it mutates style object of _html_ element by adding scrollBehavior property into it. Due to [specification](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/scroll-behavior) this property shouldn't be. And it affects also _supportsScrollBehavior_ method, because after _BlockScrollStrategy.disable_ call IE11 "supports" scroll-behavior, but it doesn't.


#### Environment

- Angular: 8.0+
- CDK/Material: 8.0+
- Browser(s): IE11
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "BlockScrollStrategy affects supportsScrollBehavior method in IE11" (#17221)

Issues.Title: fix(select): highlighted option not updated if value is reset while closed
Issues.Body:
Currently we support the same feature as the native `select` where users can change the value and the focused option while the panel is closed using the arrow keys. The problem is that if the user changes the selected option and the value gets reset, the active option doesn't get updated so next time they interact with the control, it'll pick up from the previous position. These changes add an extra call to reset the highlighted option if the value is reset.

Fixes #17212.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(select): highlighted option not updated if value is reset while closed" (#17213)

Issues.Title: [cdk-stepper] Add ability to disable _onKeyDown management
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description
Right now the cdk-stepper overrides the SPACE and ENTER keys as seen [here](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/cdk/stepper/stepper.ts#L467)

This prevents use-cases where you want to use these keys in the `matStepLabel`, such as this example where a `mat-form-field` is placed in the `matStepLabel` template ref.

We should provide a way to escape/deactivate this underlying feature for the stepper. 

#### Use Case
(see above)

Here is an example of the current behavior:
https://stackblitz.com/angular/yjpbpelmxqxd?file=app%2Fstepper-overview-example.html
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[cdk-stepper] Add ability to disable _onKeyDown management" (#17210)

Issues.Title: fix(material-experimental/slider): incorrectly rendering extra background
Issues.Body: Currently the slider always has the `mdc-slider--display-markers` class which causes an extra background to be rendered on sliders without markers. Since it's incorrect, these changes only add the class when markers are supposed to be rendered. For reference:
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material-experimental/slider): incorrectly rendering extra background" (#17207)

Issues.Title: linear stepper add attribute skippable.
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Although optional step are already skippable, but you can skip it with invalid input. I hope there is an attribute that make step are skippable when it has a valid input(can be auto fill).

#### Use Case

I have a form that use to post something. And user are quite often to have a post. And the form have max in 11 steps. And I don't want user visit all autofill step in every time. But I don't want accept invalid values cause I set step to optional.

When I using approach:
[optional]="step.vaild"
It's works, But "optional" will show up on the screen when user fill up the step. it's kinda weird. 

Because I was using same form for user edit their post. In this scenario, all step are autofilled and valid. When user edit some step, the stepper must set to linear to prevent user send invalid values. This make all step no skippable, until step by step start again. So I have to set every step interacted= true in order to allow user skip all valid step which already posted, autofilled, valid and just edit some step base on their needs. And I can't use optional, cause that will allow invalid inputs.

So I hope there is a new attribute "skippable" with only behavior which allow step can be skip when it's valid.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "linear stepper add attribute skippable." (#17206)

Issues.Title: Unable to copy text from disabled matInput on firefox. This works on Chrome and Safari.
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material-starter-nn9b35?file=app/app.component.html

Steps to reproduce:
1. Try to copy the text from the matInput textbox
2. This works on Chrome and Safari. However, unable to do so on Firefox.
 
 
#### Expected Behavior
We should be able to copy text from a disabled matInput textbox.

What behavior were you expecting to see?
The same behavior as seen in Chrome and Safari

#### Actual Behavior
Unable to copy text from disabled matInput on firefox.

What behavior did you actually see?
Unable to copy text from disabled matInput on firefox. Please look at more information on stackoverflow issue I created to get the feedback from the larger community as well.
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/58073357/unable-to-copy-text-from-disabled-matinput-on-firefox

#### Environment

- Angular:
Angular 7.0.2
- CDK/Material:
7.0.2

- Browser(s):
Chrome, Safari, Firefox (Latest)

- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): 
Windows and Mac
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Unable to copy text from disabled matInput on firefox. This works on Chrome and Safari." (#17204)

Issues.Title: Modal dialog does not block focus reaching the background aria-hidden page
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

This repros on the docs page for dialog: https://material.angular.io/components/dialog/overview

Steps:
1. Open dialog
2. Jump to the browser URL bar
3. Tab into the page
 
#### Expected Behavior

Focus should not reach inactive page elements

#### Actual Behavior

Focus reaches controls in the background of the page, and with a screen reader running this means hitting tab stops with no semantic information, since they are nested within an element with `aria-hidden`.

#### Environment

- Angular: latest
- CDK/Material: latest
- Browser(s): Firefox, Chrome, Edge (likely any browser)
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows & macOS

The `inert` attribute is a nice way to fix this if you're willing to take on a polyfill. Otherwise the only other solutions I know of are a global `focusin` listener, or walking the DOM and manipulating `tabindex` for all focusable elements (and then restoring it to the previous value on close)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Modal dialog does not block focus reaching the background aria-hidden page" (#17205)
